problem: Calculate the modified duration of a 5-year bond with 6% coupon rate, $1000 face value, trading at $950, with yield to maturity of 7%. Show detailed steps including Macaulay duration calculation.
responses:
Step-1: Determine the Bond's Yield (Macaulay Duration)
Y = PVIF(r,n,PV) = PMT*((C/PVA)^(-r)-1)/((PVAF + FV/n))
Where:
y = yield to maturity, as a decimal number
PV = present value of the bond, in this case $950
r = interest rate per period, which is 6%, or 0.06
n = periods until maturity, or 5 years x 4 quarters = 20 payments
FV = Face Value of the bond, $1000
PVAF = Present Value Annuity factor for the first payment, calculated using the formula below:

PVAF = ∑[PMTF x (1+y)^(-t)] / (1+y)^-n
where t= time to first payment, and n = total number of payments
Substituting values, we get:
PMT = annual Coupon Payment = ($1000 x 6%) / 4 = $38.44
PVAF =  ($38.44 x (1+0.06)^(-1)) / (1+0.06)^-20
= $836.81
Now, calculate Macaulay duration:
Macauley Duration (dur) = - ln(PVAF) / [ln(PV) + r]
Using calculator: dur = (- ln(836.81) / (ln($950) + 0.06)) = approximately -6.15 years
Therefore, the Macaulay duration of the bond is approximately 6.15 years.

To calculate the modified duration (D) we need to use the following formulae:

1.   Duration = Time Value of Money FV(t) - PV of Annual Payments + Principal
2.    Time Value of Money = PMT x (E / (r - i)) * (1 + r)^n
3.    Present Value of Annuity = PV of Annuity = PMT x (1 - (1 + r)^(-n))/(r - i)
4.     Present Value of Future Cash Flows = PMT x (1 + r)^n - (PMT x (1 + r)^(-n))
5.      Modified Durations = D = TFMV - PS

•   Face Value = $1000
•   Coupon Rate = 6%
•   Semi-annual Coupon payments = $60 per annum
•   Price = $950
•   Yield to Maturity = 7% (annualized)

Step 1: Calculation of Time Value of Money (FV(t)):
Time Value of Money Formula: PMT = FV / (r - i)
Where:
•	PMIT = Periodic Interest Amount = $60
•	r = interest rate = 6%/2 = 3%
•	i = discount rate = 7% annualized = 7%/2 = 3.5% semi-annually

Substituting values in the equation above and solving for PMIT, we get:
$ PMIT = $60 \* ($1000 / (3% - 3.5%)) \* (1 + 3%)^(-2) = $60 \* ($1000 / 2.85%) \* (1 + 0.03)^(-2) = $60 \* ($1000 / 2.85%) \* 0.9704 = $58.54

Therefore, the first time period's present value is:
PV of First Period = $1000 / 2.85%
